message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and laboratory values suggest pertussis, which is treated with macrolide antibiotics such as azithromycin. Chest radiograph and Penicillin are not indicated for the diagnosis and treatment of pertussis. PCR for Bordetella pertussis can confirm the diagnosis but treatment should be started even before test results are available.

Chest radiograph is not indicated in this case. Penicillin would not be effective against pertussis.
